author: Farkas Gabor
comment: Would be a great app if we could store the notes. Since they disappear with a swipe, I can't use this app to send a note about anything important. Since I would only send notes about important things, my conclusion is: the app is its current state is useless. Why would I send a note about anything unimportant? And why would I risk of losing an important note? In my opinion storing function for notes is essential.

author: zingmars
comment: can't store the notes, they just appear as notifications

author: Delia Ancuța
comment: Good

author: Tyler Woods
comment: Neat concept, however a simple swipe in the interface on my moto 360 sport caused it to crash and reboot. uninstalling...

reply.author: TomPod Apps
reply.content: Hi Tyler. Please note that we actually do not put anything on your watch, we leverage the default built in notification system on Android wear. So what ever caused your watch to reboot wasn't related to Wear Notes. We'd really appreciate it if you could confirm it this problem is persistent. Thanks!

title: Crashed

author: AhmaD GolkaR
comment: Didn't install on Lg G Watch Android 6
title: Fail

author: Darren Pierce
comment: I probably get more utility from this app than all my other Wear apps combined.

reply.author: TomPod Apps
reply.content: Happy to hear it Darren! Tell a friend :)

title: Simple, Useful, Perfect

author: Alan King
comment: Very simple to use and a handy reminder tool.

author: lee allsop
comment: Love it, really useful
title: Brill idea

author: Sepehr Golniyay
comment: It is very usefull for me . I am a student

reply.author: TomPod Apps
reply.content: Happy to read that Sepehr! Tell a friend :)

title: Love!

author: Chris Scott
comment: Great for notes that you need to quickly access. One request - would it be possible to have an option to keep the notes on screen when the display goes into power saying mode? I've seen built in apps do this (e.g. Timer) but not sure if this is an option available to any app?

reply.author: TomPod Apps
reply.content:
Hi Chris! Excellent idea, we had completely forgotten about that feature. We'll see what we can do! :)

Edit:Hi again Chris. We checked this out and unfortunately it is only possible to put apps on android wear to sleep/ambient mode. Not notifications that we're using. Maybe they'll add in the future. And if they do, we'll make sure to support it!

title: Handy app

author: Thomas Robson
comment: I've been using this app for a while and it does exactly what it says with no fuss. One little improvement would be the ability to change the 'heading' from wear notes. With small cards you could then see one line of content rather than the app name.

reply.author: TomPod Apps
reply.content:
Hi Thomas,

Great suggestion! We'll look into this.

title: Great app

author: Jimmy Crasto
comment: Good idea but can be more better if from the watch we can rply to the phone and by texting if possible. Works gr8 on my galaxy gear live. In a blink of a eye the note transfers gud very quick.
title: Something smart

author: ayinde landrum
comment: Awesome, just wish the app came up on the watch itself.
title: Great

author: Charles Gray
comment: Easy way to cheat on tests
title: Does the job

author: Arham Jamal
comment: Layout randomly gets messed up. FAB button slides beneath the status bar. The whole app move upwards.

reply.author: TomPod Apps
reply.content:
Hi Arham,

Thanks for the bug-report, we'll look in to this and will try and fix it asap!

author: M Martin
comment: Works very well, the uses are endless.
title: Wow

author: Abim Priatna
comment: Sends the notes straight to the watch in seconds.. Very good
title: Great app so far..

author: Alexandre Savard
comment: Exactly what I needed.
title: Simple yet efficient

author: Eric Grossman
comment: Please add photo support!☺

author: Arjun Rudra
comment: This application is a much needed one... Unfortunately it is limited by its inability to present information on the watch while minimized (shows the app name) and the fact that it is a dismissible notification on your phone. Being able to add custom text to the A nice update to usability would be : being able to add custom 1 line text to the minimized view and not having a persistent notification on your phone

reply.author: TomPod Apps
reply.content:
Hi Arjun,

Excellent idea! I'll see if we can implement this. Because you're absolutely right, that would be the best way to do it. So cards (on android wear) can be minimised and you'll still get some data. I'll put it on our todo!

title: Nice idea but limited by the notification delivery method

author: Danny Kirk
comment: Ok, so I could send a saved message from my phone to my huawei watch. Problem is I could not save it to my watch. So I have to pull my phone out to send it to my watch each time? What's the point? Am i missing something? Its easier to save a message to Google keep from my watch  by voice and then I can read it anytime on my watch!

author: Tommy Binkley
comment: Doesn't work.

reply.author: TomPod Apps
reply.content: Hi there Tommy, What seems to be the problem? Please drop us a mail at info@tompod.com so we can help out!

author: justin singh
comment: Doesnt send notes

reply.author: TomPod Apps
reply.content: Hi Justin. We're sorry to hear that, and without sending notes - it's a pretty pointless app. Can we help? Drop us a email at info@tompod.com and we'll get to the bottom of this!

author: Virtua Life
comment: not useful

reply.author: TomPod Apps
reply.content:
Hi Mashad,

Sorry you didn't find our app useful. Is there anything we can do to help out? If so, drop us a mail at info@tompod.com.
